Content: The Supreme Court is due to reveal its decision today (02) regarding the petition filed by MP Geetha Kumarasinghe against the Appeal Court decision that her parliamentary seat was not legal. When the relevant petition was taken up for hearing before a five-member bench of judges, chaired by Chief Justice Priyasad Dep yesterday, it was decided to reveal the relevant verdict today. The Appeal court had decided on 3rd May that according to the provisions of the constitution, a parliamentary seat could not be held by MP Geetha Kumarasinghe on account of her holding citizenship for both Sri Lanka and Switzerland.
